Class LoginFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.manage.Initializable, java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class LoginFragment
extends InteractionFragment
    A generic login fragment for the authentication process of an application.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginFragment

        public LoginFragment()
        Default constructor with 3 allowed login attempts and 5 seconds initial wait time.

      • LoginFragment

        public LoginFragment(int nMaxLoginAttemptsUntilDelay,
                     int nInitialLoginErrorWaitTime)
        Creates a new instance with the given login failure parameters.
        Parameters:
        nMaxLoginAttemptsUntilDelay - The maximum number of login attempts that can be done until the user must wait a certain time before the next attempt. -1 disabled login attempt delays completely.
        nInitialLoginErrorWaitTime - The initial time in seconds the user must wait after the maximum number of login attempts has been reached; this will double with each failure cycle.

      • isUserAuthorized

        protected boolean isUserAuthorized(Entity rUser)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Will be invoked after the user has been successfully authenticated to check whether she is authorized to use the application. Can be overridden by subclasses that need to check additional constraints. Only if this method returns TRUE will the process be initialized with the authentication data. The default implementation always returns TRUE.
        Parameters:
        rUser - The user that has been authenticated
        Returns:
        TRUE if the user is authorized to use the application, FALSE if not
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Implementations may alternatively throw any kind of exception if the authorization fails. This has the same effect as returning FALSE.

      • performLogin

        protected void performLogin()
        Handles the login action that occurred.
